text: hey everybody thomas joseph here and
today i'm answering one of the most
popular kitchen conundrums that you have
asked and that is about sweet potato
fries and how to avoid the flaccid limp
insipid sweet potato fry and get a
perfectly crisp sweet potato fry and
today i'm gonna share with you a few
tricks in achieving a crisp sweet potato
fry on the outside but with a perfectly
cooked inside to that sweet potato
to start we need a sweet potato I like
to peel the sweet potatoes I like to get
rid of the skin now if you are a fan of
the added nutrients that are in the skin
you could certainly leave them on I just
think it gives a uniform appearance to
the sweet potatoes when you peel them in
total we need about a pound of sweet
potatoes and that's from like two large
sweet potatoes and I'm going to cut
these into nice uniform pieces that's
kind of one of the things that is really
necessary in in cooking things evenly is
uniformity so try to use your knife
skills here to cut these sweet potatoes
into nice even pieces I like to with any
vegetable that kind of has curbs to it
that rolls around on your board I like
to trim off one end so that it creates a
nice stable flat end so the sweet potato
isn't rolling around on you and we want
about half inch planks now so you can
use a ruler or you can eyeball it just
make sure that they're evenly sliced
here and then you're gonna take each of
those planks and you're gonna cut them
again into half-inch pieces as well now
sweet potatoes do not have the starch
content of regular you know russet or
Yukon Gold potatoes so they're never
really gonna achieve the crispness that
you would get from a regular french fry
but there are some tricks and tips here
guys in achieving the crispiest fry
possible for a sweet potato so I'm
putting these into a large bowl over
here as you can see and I'm going to
toss these with a little bit of olive
oil now I have an oven preheated to 450
degrees so a pretty hot hot temperature
if you have a convection setting on your
oven I would encourage you to use that
and you might want to reduce the
temperature down to 425 degrees if
you're using convection but that nice
superheated air that's what convection
is it's the movement of air within the
oven so there's a fan going it helps you
have even temperatures throughout your
oven which will help the food
kind of cook at a faster pace so I'm
gonna toss these sweet potatoes with the
oil just to evenly coat and a little bit
of seasoning so some coarse salt if
you're a fan of pepper you can use a
little bit of black pepper and toss
these to combine and now I'm gonna go to
my oven and get that superhot preheated
pan so superhot pan here be very careful
and I'm gonna take half of the potatoes
here because I really only want you can
hear the sizzle guys this is really hot
you really only want an even layer on
your pan don't overcrowd because if you
overcrowd what you're gonna do is you're
gonna create steam and you're not gonna
get any of those crisp edges to the
sweet potato fries so you might have to
do this in batches or use two baking
sheets but this is going back into the
oven again at that superhot 450 degrees
for about ten minutes and then we're
going to flip the fries with a spatula
and continue cooking until they're nice
and golden brown about another ten to
fifteen minutes more all right guys our
sweet potatoes are out of the oven it's
been about 25 minutes in total and you
can see they're nice and dark and a
golden brown color they're super super
hot but you can see if you pick them up
they're pretty rigid they don't flop
over
like our soggy friends over here the
inside should be slightly creamy and the
outside should be crisp now again these
don't have the starch content of a
russet potato or a Yukon Gold potato so
they're not really gonna be like
shattering crisp but they should have a
nice texture to them let's give it a try
you can hear again it's like a chewy
crispness but they're really delicious
now I encourage you the next time you're
trying to make sweet potato fries use
the tricks that we've outlined using a
preheated sheet tray making sure that
you cut your sweet potato fries and nice
even pieces and don't overcrowd your pan
because they will steam and your family
will love the sweet potato fries you put
on the table now if you have any kitchen
